pros: My coworkers were the only reason I stayed there for so long.

review_title: A Great Company to Work For
pros: This company listens to their employees. If I have any concerns or suggestions to improve things, I can talk with my manager and they are willing to help me. They offer a competitive and comprehensive benefit package (everything from Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, all the way to Pet Insurance). I am happy to be apart of this organization and feel they invest into their employees. They have opportunities for promotion and will invest in their staff to set them up for success in those positions. Wesley also hosts fun activities for everyone to participate in, like a Summer Picnic and Nursing Care Week for example. They show they care for their employees the same way they care for their residents and make this a fun place to work.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about this company.

pros: My co-workers are amazing! Everyone here is so nice and very helpful. They are all excellent at their jobs and truly care about the residents. Everyone goes the extra mile to support each other and give the residents the best possible experience. I have been to five of the communities and they are all beautiful and have caring staff.  If you are seeking a career at a caring community and would like to be part of an outstanding team, then Wesley is the place for you.
cons: I honestly can't think of anything.  This is a great place.

pros: The employees are very supportive of their co-workers.  Wesley is a great place to work, their is a true compassion for the residents & fellow employees.
cons: I believe great jobs are hard to come by, your job is what you make it & I believe Wesley truly cares about their employees.

pros: The residents were great. Besides them and my co-workers, the highlight of my time working there. Residents are appreciative. Flexible schedule--for school, other jobs, family.
cons: There is honestly no room for growth-- be prepared to stay in a position for a long time. There is an extreme lack of communication. Blame is often put on the employees and not upper management. Higher ups have little to no appreciation for employees. Company culture isn't that great. Employees are miserable. Managers insist on an "open door" policy--but employees' concerns/opinion/comments are ignore.

job_title: Personal Care Aide in Hatboro, PA
pros: Tuition reimbursement for full time staff, you learn a lot on the job, that's really all the pros I can think of.
cons: Low pay & poor raises. The most they give these days is 2%, which usually amounts to $.25 if you're lucky. Upper management doesn't care about staff or the residents. They just want the beds filled to make $$$. There isn't much recognition for employees who go above & beyond.  Overall low morale.  Most employees in my dept. hate working here.

pros: Wesley Enhanced Living is an amazing company with a great mission. I am proud to work here and to feel as though I am actually making a difference every day. It is a great work environment, great benefits, and I enjoy going to work every day. I also love that management seems to really want to see you grow and succeed.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: The residents care more about you than upper management.
job_title: Personal Care Aide in Hatboro, PA
pros: The residents are nice and let you know you're appreciated.  Employees try to help each other for the most part.
cons: Corporate doesn't seem to care about problems within the communities. They will pinch pennies & skimp where they can. They will do anything to fill a room.  Don't pay enough for work done & don't show that much appreciation.

job_title: Former Staff Member in Doylestown, PA
pros: Residents are nice to be around and care about the employees.  The low level staff is always nice to each other and works together.
cons: The managers and especially the top people in that corporate office don't care about the low level staff at the community.

review_title: Wesley is a Great Place to Work
pros:
Wesley was just named #6 as a great place to work. It really is at Pennypack
I like it because my supervisor is flexible with my schedule
pay is good and I get a great shiff differential if I work weekends
benefits are good. tuition reimbursement.
cons: I m single so the cost of benefits is really low for me. I have heard other employees that say the medical insurance is good but to expensive for family coverage.

review_title: Worst senior living company in the Greater Philadelphia area.
pros: Residents are great, free parking (big parking lot), average pay rate and fair time off (they offer that because not many people stay long enough to take advantage of the vacation time off).
cons:
Wesley Enhanced Living in Media has no leadership, there is no work/life balance. The community is rundown and need of repairs desperately. Not the best work environment and hoping that another company buys this community. Wesley has downgraded since buying this community about a year and half ago.

Leadership, Wesley Enhanced Living owners, work/life balance

pros: I loved my Team and the Nurses and CNAs that I worked with.  The patients and their families were great as well.
cons: No accountability for Senior Management.  Corporate Human Resources is there to protect the company and Senior Management, not the employees.They will terminate without cause and without warning based on the arbitrary, undocumented and poorly communicated "expectations" of Senior Leaders.  They will down play your successes while not being able to provide concrete failures.  I was blindsided with a termination with no explanation, no previous warning or disciplinary action and never even given an opportunity to defend myself or correct things to meet my bosses "expectations".  Get an employment contract and have it reviewed by a lawyer otherwise your job will constantly be on the line.  They love falling back on the PA is an "at will state" line, which really means, there is no job security without a contract.  Make sure you document everything and make sure whoever you report to documents everything as well.  Protect yourself because Wesley won't.  Plus it would be wise to have a labor lawyer handy.  I wish I had.

pros: The managers are nice and hours are very flexible! Good for students living in the area who would like to work part time.
cons: Hours are limited as people are hired and let go pretty often. Not difficult to keep the job as long as you do your work

pros: Great environment, team work, wonderful Residents.  A very positive set of working conditions with employees who care about each other and their Residents
cons: Community is a little land-locked

review_title: Great First Job or to start a career in nursing!
pros: Structured, clean, positive, team environment.  Good benefits, shift differentials and holiday incentives.  Plus, its a rewarding job in the fact that you are helping those who need it!
cons: Just like anywhere else, there are imperfections but overall, its a great place to be.

review_title: Wesley Enhanced Living at Stapely is a great place to work!
pros:
- Good opportunities for growth; transferring to another department, promotions, schooling. 
-Good culture. Everyone who works here really cares about the residents. 
-Good teamwork. Other departments are always willing to jump in and help when it is needed.
cons: I cannot think of a single issue to work here.

pros: Meeting some of the caring and thoughtful residents who live there, as well as the other nurse aides who work there.
cons: This job requires lots of work but very little pay. No one helps each other because someone is always trying to get you in trouble.

pros: Was there for 5 years in nursing. I loved caring for the residents and the director was wonderful to work with.
cons: I had to use public transportation so sometimes my commute was tough.

pros: Caring & Enthusiastic Coworkers/Excellent Benefits, Including Tuition Reimbursement/Fun Atmosphere/Open to New Ideas & Better Ways
cons: No Cons/Wesley Enhanced Living is a Great Place to Work. A single employee's healthcare out of pocket cost is about as low as you are going to find.

review_title: Good opportunities for those who care about seniors.
pros: Competitive salaries for most and tuition reumbursment if you wish to further you education.
cons: Lack of cohesieve direction in upper leadership.

pros: The residents make this job all worth while.  They are the best!
